Fatty fish are more susceptible to lipid oxidation due to unsaturated fatty acids (USFAs). Lipid oxidation is a major cause of fish rancidity and flavor deterioration. In this regard, the POV is used to determine hydro peroxides as the primary products of fat oxidation in fish.

It has been reported that the amount of peroxide in the fish covered with nisin and rosemary extract is significantly lower than the control treatment. These findings are in agreement with the current research results.
